questions.question: Which of the following statements are NOT true about nitrogen-fixing bacteria?
options: Converts nitrogen gas into ammonium ions
Are found in nodules on the roots of legumes
Break down nitrate ions into ammonium ions
Plays a vital role in the nitrogen cycle in nature

questions.question: The only acellular micro-organism is:
Which of the following are the most significant factors in determining biome type?
Biodiversity is:
options: An area with specific biotic and abiotic conditions
A measure taken by people to restore an ecosystem
Replacement of one ecosystem by another ecosystem
A measure of the overall variability of life on the Earth

questions.question: The presence of several different biomes within Ethiopia results in:
options: The high species richness of plants and mammals
The low species richness of plants and mammals
The high species richness of plants but low mammals
The high species richness of mammals but low plant

questions.question: The genetic code is NOT a:
Chromosomes are made from two chemicals:
options: DNA and a set of globular proteins
RNA and a set of globular proteins
DNA and a set of fibrous proteins
RNA and a set of fibrous proteins

questions.question: A woman with unknown blood type and a man also with unknown blood type could potentially have four children with all blood groups in different years. What are the possible blood groups of the parents?
Cytosine makes up 42% of the nucleotides in a sample of DNA from an organism. Approximately what percentage of the nucleotides in this sample will be thymine?
A person who has type O blood has:
options: A antigens on the cell surface
B antigens on the cell surface
No surface antigens on the cells
Both A and B antigens on the cell surface

questions.question: The four daughter cells produced in meiosis will have a:
options: n number of chromosomes and will differ genetically from each other
2n number of chromosomes and will differ genetically from each other
2n number of chromosomes and will be genetically identical to each other
n number of chromosomes and will be genetically identical to each other

questions.question: What characterizes a prokaryotic cell?
A larger brain NOT allows humans to:
options: Create life on the planet Earth
Plan in advance to avoid attack
Develop and use tools and weapons
Run faster in a more upright posture

questions.question: When single-stranded DNA from a human is mixed with single-stranded DNA from a chimpanzee, we find that about 98% of the DNA is homologous. This can be taken as evidence that:
options: Humans and chimpanzees are closely related
Humans and chimpanzees originated in similar environments

questions.question: Which of following is NOT the observations on which Darwin based his theory of evolution?
options: The offspring show a great deal of genetic variation
Characteristics are inheritable from parent to offspring
The inheritance of the acquired traits from parent to offspring
Competition of offspring for resources (survival of the fittest)

questions.question: Which of the following determines the sex of a child?
options: The length of the mother’s pregnancy period
The presence of a Y chromosome in a sperm
The presence of an X chromosome in an ovum
The length of time between ovulation and copulation

questions.question: A cross between two individuals results in a ratio of 9:3:1 for four possible phenotypes of progeny. This is an example of a:
A pregnant woman has an equal chance of her baby being blood group A or blood group AB. Which one of the following shows the possible genotypes of the woman and the father of her child?
Functions of transferases enzymes:
options: Change of the molecular form of the substrate molecules
Joining of two molecules by the formation of new bonds
Transfer of a specific group from one substrate to another
Removal of nonhydrolytic group from a substrate molecules

questions.question: Some enzymes have been named based on the source from which they were first identified. An example of this is:
In which organelle would the given events most likely occur?
In cellular respiration process, the carriers for the electron transport system are located:
options: Within the cytoplasm of a cell

questions.question: Which of the following pathways will use coenzyme A during aerobic cellular respiration?
How many times does the Krebs cycle turn per glucose molecule break down?
Which one of the following metabolic pathways is common in aerobic and anaerobic respiration?
The light reactions occur in the ______ while the Calvin cycle occurs in the ______
Which of the following processes produces the most ATP per molecule of glucose oxidized?
What are the products of the light reactions that are subsequently used by the independent reaction of photosynthesis?
The immediate products of C3 and C4 photosynthesis in the light-independent reactions of the Calvin cycle are, respectively:

In which of the following type of dominance, both extremes have a selective advantage compared with the mean and the two distinct types begin to emerge showing the extreme values of the original population?
The structure of a protein that describes the overall shape formed by several polypeptide chains which compose the protein?
Which of the following organisms have the greatest problem with photorespiration?
Which of the following is NOT archaebacteria?
Which of the following is abiotic factors that influence how quickly a population of the same species or of a different species increases in size or decreases in size?
Why is the leaf boiled in alcohol using a water bath instead of direct heating in starch test?
options: To prevent alcohol from igniting due to flammability
To enhance iodine’s reactivity with starch

questions.question: If a student skips boiling leaf in water first, what is the most likely outcome?
options: Chlorophyll will not be removed, masking the iodine test result
Enzymes in the leaf will continue metabolizing starch, leading to a false negative
The leaf cells will rupture, releasing starch prematurely
Iodine will fail to penetrate the leaf’s waxy cuticle

questions.question: What observation confirms the presence of starch in the leaf?
options: The leaf turns yellow-brown upon iodine application
The leaf develops a blue-black coloration
The chlorophyll dissolves, revealing white patches
The iodine solution forms a purple precipitate

questions.question: The conversion of one molecule of glucose to two molecules of pyruvate results in the net formation of:
Unknown enzyme added to starch and sucrose. Starch positive, sucrose negative. Which enzyme?
Competitive inhibitors stop an enzyme from working by:
options: Changing the shape of the enzyme molecule
Binding with the substrate to form complex product
Combining with the end product of the biological reaction
Blocking the active site of the enzyme in a reversible manner

questions.question: The type of enzyme that removes a phosphate group from a molecule is called:
Which of the following organelles is responsible for producing ATP?
Which blood vessels carry blood away from the heart?
In which phase of meiosis do homologous chromosomes separate?
Which of the following is NOT a function of the liver?
Which of the following is a C4 plant?
Which macromolecule is primarily used for long-term energy storage in animals?
What is the main product of glycolysis?
Which of the following is a density-dependent factor affecting population growth?
Which organelle is responsible for protein modification and packaging?
Which type of RNA carries the genetic information from DNA to ribosomes?
Which process produces gametes with half the chromosome number of the parent?
Which of the following is an example of mutualism?
Which biomolecule forms the main structural component of cell membranes?
Which type of selection favors individuals with traits at both extremes?
The primary structure of a protein is:
options: Alpha helix or beta sheet folding

questions.question: Which hormone regulates blood sugar levels?
Which type of nucleic acid stores genetic information?
Which ecological pyramid shows the number of organisms at each trophic level?
Which of the following is a function of the kidney?
Which blood type is considered the universal donor?
Which process in plants converts CO2 into glucose?
Which structure controls the movement of substances in and out of the cell?
Which stage of mitosis involves separation of sister chromatids?
Which enzyme synthesizes RNA from a DNA template?
Which of the following is a biotic factor in an ecosystem?
Which type of macromolecule is an enzyme?
Which organelle contains digestive enzymes to break down macromolecules?
Which type of RNA brings amino acids to the ribosome?
Which of the following is NOT a greenhouse gas?
Which of the following is the main energy currency of the cell?
Which type of selection favors individuals with intermediate traits?
Which part of the brain controls coordination and balance?
Which of the following is an example of parasitism?
Which type of chemical bond holds together the two strands of DNA?
Which organ produces insulin?
Which process breaks down glucose to produce energy in the absence of oxygen?
Which of the following is NOT part of the light-dependent reactions of photosynthesis?
Which type of organism is a primary consumer in a food chain?
Which molecule carries genetic information from the nucleus to the cytoplasm?
Which vitamin is synthesized by exposure to sunlight?
Which of the following is a characteristic of prokaryotic cells?
Which of the following best describes evolution?
options: Change in allele frequencies over time

questions.question: Which plant tissue is responsible for transporting water?
Which stage of the cell cycle involves DNA replication?
Which type of ecological interaction benefits both species involved?
Which organ filters blood and produces urine?
Which enzyme breaks down starch into maltose?
Which type of mutation involves a single nucleotide change?
Which part of the brain regulates heartbeat and breathing?
Which type of enzyme speeds up a reaction without being consumed?
Which macronutrient provides the most energy per gram?
Which blood component is primarily responsible for clotting?
Which type of cell division produces genetically identical daughter cells?
Which of the following is a characteristic of eukaryotic cells?
Which process in plants results in water loss from leaves?
Which trophic level consists of organisms that produce their own food?
Which type of RNA is part of the ribosome structure?
Which organ is the main site of nutrient absorption in humans?
Which enzyme catalyzes the formation of RNA from DNA?
